content: For goals less than 3 years away, allocation to Equity should be 0%. High volatility makes equity unsuitable for short timelines. Stick to Arbitrage Funds or Liquid Debt.
For goals 3-7 years away, a balanced Hybrid approach (40-60% Equity) is best. It balances growth with capital safety.
For goals 10+ years away (like Retirement), Equity allocation should be high (70-90%) to beat inflation. Volatility smooths out over long periods.
Section 80C allows tax deduction up to â‚¹1.5 Lakhs. ELSS (Equity Linked Savings Scheme) is the best instrument with the shortest lock-in period of 3 years compared to PPF (15 years).
Before investing, ensure you have an Emergency Fund covering 6-12 months of expenses. Keep this in a Liquid Fund or Sweep-in FD, not in the stock market.
Gold acts as a hedge against inflation and currency depreciation. A 10-15% allocation to SGB (Sovereign Gold Bonds) is recommended for long-term portfolios.
When Nifty 50 PE Ratio exceeds 25, the market is considered expensive. Reduce lump sum investments and stick to SIPs.
Debt Funds are for stability, not high returns. Avoid Credit Risk funds unless you are an expert. Stick to Gilt or Corporate Bond funds for safety.
